answerText: homologous[10] All organisms that share a homologous trait make up one of these.  This is defined as the group consisting of an organism and all descendant organisms on a phylogenetic tree.
heading: 2010 ACF Fall |2010 | Bellarmine and UCLA (1) | 19 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Unlike homoplasy, this term implies that the trait is present in the common ancestor. For 10 points each: [10] Name this term that refers to traits that have a common origin that is often contrasted with analogous.
